text: Bill Enis (January 24, 1934 â€“ December 14, 1973) was a sportscaster who called games for the Houston Oilers and Houston Astros. He called games for the American Football League, National Football League, and Major League Baseball for NBC until his death in 1973 of a heart attack. ==References== Category:Major League Baseball broadcasters Category:National Football League broadcasters Category:1973 deaths Category:1934 births
title: Bill Enis
